news_header: The 2024 US presidential election is set for November 5, with an increase in eligible Black voters and varying turnout rates among different demographics.
news_text: Election day in the US will be on November 5, 2024, with approximately 244 million eligible voters. Voter participation has increased, with 66% of eligible voters participating in the 2020 election. Racial disparities exist, as 71% of white voters voted compared to 58.4% of non-white voters. Black voters predominantly support Democrats, with 87% voting for Biden in 2020. The number of eligible Black voters is projected to rise by 7% from 2020. Young voters showed increased turnout, with 50% voting in 2020. Women also voted at higher rates than men, with 68.4% participation. Polls indicate a potential shift in female voter support for Biden, raising questions about Kamala Harris's ability to attract voters in the upcoming election.
